description: Update website content to match current toolkit state, with focus on documenting the testing system architecture

userStories.title: Update Testing Architecture Overview
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to understand how the testing system is organized so I can use the right agent for my testing needs.
acceptanceCriteria: Create a 'Testing System' section on the concepts page explaining the architecture
Document the three tester modes: Story Mode, Ad-hoc Mode, Full Suite Mode
Show the hierarchy: tester orchestrator → specialist testers → QA system
Include a visual diagram or structured list showing agent relationships
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: testing concepts page renders correctly with new sections

userStories.title: Document Tester Orchestrator Agent
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to understand how the tester orchestrator works so I know when and how tests are automatically generated.
acceptanceCriteria: Add detailed documentation for the 'tester' agent on the agents page
Explain the three operational modes with examples: Story Mode, Ad-hoc Mode, Full Suite Mode
Document the routing logic to specialist testers (jest-tester, react-tester, go-tester)
Explain test loop handling (max 3 attempts, then defer)
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: tester agent documentation page displays correctly

userStories.title: Document Unit Test Specialists
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to understand the specialist testing agents so I know which one handles my stack.
acceptanceCriteria: Document jest-tester: Backend JavaScript/TypeScript testing
Document react-tester: React component testing with React Testing Library
Document go-tester: Go testing with testify and httptest
Explain how projects can override global testers with project-specific versions
Show the file patterns each specialist handles
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.notes: Added Unit Test Specialists section with detailed agent cards for jest-tester, react-tester, and go-tester. Includes file patterns, frameworks, key capabilities, and project override system documentation.
userStories.e2eScope: unit test specialist agent pages render correctly

userStories.title: Document E2E Testing Agents
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to understand the E2E testing system so I can use it effectively for UI testing.
acceptanceCriteria: Document e2e-playwright: Writes Playwright E2E tests for UI areas
Document e2e-reviewer: Reviews UI changes and identifies areas needing E2E tests
Document playwright-dev: Implements Playwright test automation tasks
Document e2e-tester: Primary agent for running full E2E test suites
Explain the workflow: reviewer identifies areas → playwright writes tests → tester runs them
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: E2E agent documentation pages render correctly

userStories.title: Document QA Adversarial Testing System
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to understand the QA system so I can use it to find bugs through exploratory testing.
acceptanceCriteria: Document qa coordinator agent and its dispatch mechanism
Document qa-explorer: Adversarial testing with browser-use CLI
Document qa-browser-tester: Converting bug findings into Playwright tests
Explain the flow: qa coordinates → explorer finds bugs → browser-tester creates regression tests
Mention the browser-use CLI dependency and how it enables autonomous browsing
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: QA system documentation pages render correctly

userStories.title: Document E2E Quality Patterns Skill
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to understand the E2E quality patterns so I can catch issues beyond basic correctness.
acceptanceCriteria: Add the e2e-quality skill to the skills documentation
Document each pattern with examples: assertNeverAppears, withPerformanceBudget, assertNoLayoutShift, assertStableRender, measureCLS, assertStateStability, expectMutualExclusivity
Explain when to use quality patterns vs basic assertions
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: e2e-quality skill documentation renders with code examples

userStories.title: Document Test Flow Skill
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to understand the test flow automation so I know how tests are generated and managed during development.
acceptanceCriteria: Add the test-flow skill to the skills documentation
Document the automatic test generation triggers
Explain the fix loop mechanism (attempt fixes up to 3 times)
Document E2E deferral when tests cannot be fixed immediately
Show how test flow integrates with the tester agent
Typecheck passes
Lint passes

userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to understand the mutation testing requirements so I write tests that properly verify state changes.
acceptanceCriteria: Add a 'Mutation Testing' concept explaining the 3-step pattern
Document the three verification stages: immediate state, stable state, persistence

Explain why each stage is necessary

acceptanceCriteria: Run npm run sync and verify toolkit-manifest.json contains all 10 testers
